src:
FOTO: Demo di Chile Kembali Memanas
02 Nov 2019, 19:13 by AP PHOTO, AFP PHOTO, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Aksi demonstrasi kembali terjadi pada Jumat (1/11) di alun-alun Plaza Italia, Chile, bertepatan dengan perayaan All Saints Day.


Aksi demonstrasi kembali terjadi pada Jumat (1/11) di alun-alun Plaza Italia, Chile, bertepatan dengan perayaan All Saints Day. (AP Photo/Rodrigo Abd)



Diperkirakan 20 ribu pendemo mengenakan pakaian serba hitam turun ke jalan menyuarakan keadilan bagi mereka yang meninggal dunia pada demo dua yang berakhir rusuh dua pekan terakhir. (AP Photo/Rodrigo Abd)



Para pendemo mengepalkan tangan ke udara dan long-march dengan mengibarkan bendera pribumi Chili dan Mapuche untuk menuntut keadilan. (AP Photo/Rodrigo Abd)



Pasukan keamanan mencoba membubarkan pengunjuk rasa dengan menembakkan gas air mata dan meriam air. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



Dalam demo sebelumnya dilaporkan 20 orang meninggal dunia dan 1.300 orang luka-luka. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



Gejolak di Chile dipicu kenaikan tarif transportasi umum khusus pada jam sibuk sebesar US$1,17 atau sekitar Rp16 ribu. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



Masyarakat mengkritik kebijakan pemerintah karena lambatnya pertumbuhan ekonomi. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



Dalam aksinya, pendemo mendesak pemerintah mengubah Undang-Undang Tenaga Kerja, Perpajakan, dan Jaminan Pensiun. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



Presiden Chile, Sebastian Pinera memutuskan membatalkan kenaikan tarif transportasi umum dan merombak kabinet. (AP Photo/Rodrigo Abd)



Pinera berencana menaikkan tunjangan pensiun, upah minimum regional dan menunda kenaikan tarif dasar listrik. (AP Photo/Rodrigo Abd)
text:
PHOTO: Demo in Chile Heats Up Again
02 Nov 2019, 19:13 by AP PHOTO, AFP PHOTO, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia
Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Demonstrations took place again on Friday (1/11) in the Plaza Italia square, Chile, to coincide with the celebration of All Saints Day.


Demonstrations took place again on Friday (1/11) in the Plaza Italia square, Chile, to coincide with the celebration of All Saints Day. (AP Photo / Rodrigo Abd)



An estimated 20 thousand demonstrators dressed in black took to the streets voicing justice for those who died in the second demonstration that ended in riot the past two weeks. (AP Photo / Rodrigo Abd)



Demonstrators clenched their fists in the air and long-march by raising the native Chilean and Mapuche flags to demand justice. (AP Photo / Rodrigo Abd)



Security forces tried to disperse the protesters by firing tear gas and water cannons. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



In the previous demo 20 people were reported dead and 1,300 injured. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



The turmoil in Chile was triggered by an increase in the tariff for public transportation specifically during peak hours of US $ 1.17 or around Rp16 thousand. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



People criticize government policies because of slow economic growth. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



In the action, the demonstrators urged the government to amend the Labor Law, Taxation and Pension Guarantees. (Photo by CLAUDIO REYES / AFP)



The President of Chile, Sebastian Pinera, decided to cancel the increase in public transportation tariffs and overhaul the cabinet. (AP Photo / Rodrigo Abd)



Pinera plans to increase pension benefits, regional minimum wages and delay raising basic electricity tariffs. (AP Photo / Rodrigo Abd)
